message: Tolosano is joined in the Calais project by a team of over fifteen students specializing in international issues, law and public relations, who work closely with their professor, Kaija Schilde, other professors, practitioners in the field of anti-human trafficking, software engineers and specialists in data protection.

data.description: The BU student, who split her childhood between Romania and France, is developing software to keep child refugees safe by allowing them to communicate with humanitarian workers.
data.title: Smaranda Tolosano's Fight Against Human Trafficking
